t: Dead Idols and the Living God
Bel*pn bows down, Nebo stoops; Their*ld idols were on the beasts and on the cattle. Your*ld carriages were*i heavily loaded, A*ld burden to the weary beast.*i
They*ld stoop, they bow down together; They*ld could not deliver the burden, But*ld have themselves gone into captivity.
“Listen*ln to Me, O house of Jacob, And*ld all the remnant of the house of Israel, Who*ld have been upheld by*i Me*i from birth, Who*ld have been carried from the womb:
Even*ld to your*i old age, I am*i He, And*ld even*i to gray hairs I will carry you!*i I*ld have made, and I will bear; Even*ld I will carry, and will deliver you.*i
“To*ln whom will you liken Me, and make Me*i equal And*ld compare Me, that we should be alike?
They*ld lavish gold out of the bag, And*ld weigh silver on the scales; They*ld hire a goldsmith, and he makes it a god; They*ld prostrate themselves, yes, they worship.

They*ld bear it on the shoulder, they carry it And*ld set it in its place, and it stands; From*ld its place it shall not move. Though*ld one*i cries out to it, yet it cannot answer Nor*ld save him out of his trouble.
“Remember*ln this, and show yourselves men; Recall*ld to mind, O you transgressors.
Remember*ld the former things of old, For*ld I am*i God, and there*i is*i no other; I*ild am*i God, and there*i is*i none like Me,
Declaring*ld the end from the beginning, And*ld from ancient times things*i that are not yet*i done, Saying,*ld ‘My counsel shall stand, And*ld I will do all My pleasure,’

Calling*ld a bird of prey from the east, The*ld man who executes My counsel, from a far country. Indeed*ld I have spoken it;*i I*ld will also bring it to pass. I*ld have purposed it;*i I*ld will also do it.
“Listen*ln to Me, you stubborn-hearted, Who*ld are*i far from righteousness:
I*ld bring My righteousness near, it shall not be far off; My*ld salvation shall not linger. And*ld I will place salvation in Zion, For*ld Israel My glory.
